classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: Apache Software License
info.description:
django-bootstrap-staticfiles
============================

This package provides a Django_ app whose ``static`` folder contains the
compiled assets of Bootstrap_.

Each Bootstrap version will be tagged accordingly.

Setup
-----

1. Install the app::

    pip install django-bootstrap-staticfiles

2. Inlude it in your Django project::

    # settings.py:

    INSTALLED_APPS = (
        ...
        'django_bootstrap_staticfiles',
        ...
    )

3. Make sure ``django.contrib.staticfiles.finders.AppDirectoriesFinder`` is in
   your list of ``STATICFILES_FINDERS``.

Usage
-----

If you're not using an asset manager, you can just include them as usual in
your site templates.::

    {% load staticfiles %}
    ...
    <script type="text/javascript" src="{% static 'js/bootstrap.min.js' %}"></script>
    ...

.. _Django: https://www.djangoproject.com
.. _Bootstrap: http://getbootstrap.com
info.name: django-bootstrap-staticfiles
info.summary: Django app that provides compiled Bootstrap assets
info.html_description:
This package provides a Django app whose static folder contains the compiled assets of Bootstrap.

Each Bootstrap version will be tagged accordingly.

Setup

  1. Install the app:

    pip install django-bootstrap-staticfiles

  2. Inlude it in your Django project:

    # settings.py:

INSTALLED_APPS = (
    ...
    'django_bootstrap_staticfiles',
    ...
)

  3. Make sure django.contrib.staticfiles.finders.AppDirectoriesFinder is in your list of STATICFILES_FINDERS.

Usage

If you’re not using an asset manager, you can just include them as usual in your site templates.:

{% load staticfiles %}
...
<script type="text/javascript" src="{% static 'js/bootstrap.min.js' %}"></script>
...
